sentences.en: "It's rather embarrassing," he began, and paused.
sentences.cn: “非常令人难堪，”他开口道，然后停顿了一下。

sentences.en: Attempts to find civilian volunteers have met with embarrassing failure.
sentences.cn: 寻找平民志愿者的种种尝试都遭遇了令人难堪的失败。

sentences.en: Having lost my money, I was in an embarrassing position.
sentences.cn: 我丟了钱, 处境很窘.

sentences.en: His jokes didn't even raise a smile, which was embarrassing.
sentences.cn: 听了他讲的笑话,都没人笑一下, 真是太尴尬了.

sentences.en: His people came up with a load of embarrassing information.
sentences.cn: 他的部下亮出一大堆令人尴尬的资料来。

sentences.en: I had one of my most embarrassing moments in panto in Nottingham.
sentences.cn: 在诺丁汉我经历了自己在童话剧演出中最尴尬的时刻之一。

sentences.en: I was in the embarrassing position of having completely forgotten her name.
sentences.cn: 当时我完全忘记了她的名字,很是尴尬.

sentences.en: It was an embarrassing situation, but she managed to laugh it off.
sentences.cn: 那个场面很尴尬, 可她一笑摆脱了窘境.

sentences.en: It's rather embarrassing; I don't know how to bring it up.
sentences.cn: 这事有点碍口, 不好说.

sentences.en: Men find it embarrassing to be honest.
sentences.cn: 实话实说让男人觉得难为情。

sentences.en: Of all speech impediments stammering is probably the most embarrassing.
sentences.cn: 在所有言语障碍中，口吃可能是最令人尴尬的。

sentences.en: She asked a lot of embarrassing questions.
sentences.cn: 她问了许多令人尴尬的问题。

sentences.en: That was an embarrassing situation for me.

sentences.cn: 对话十分难堪，让人不堪忍受。

sentences.en: The speech was deeply embarrassing to Cabinet ministers.
sentences.cn: 这席话让内阁大臣们非常难堪。

sentences.en: The story was very close to the bone and most embarrassing.
sentences.cn: 这个故事很下流,让人极其难堪.

words.tran_cn: 使人尴尬地；令人难堪地
窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据
使...困窘；使...局促不安（embarrass的过去分词形式）
使局促不安；使困窘；阻碍

trans.tran_cn: 令人尴尬/难堪的，使显得愚蠢的
trans.tran_en: making you feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable
